twcore.core.net
Class GamePacketGenerator

java.lang.Object
  twcore.core.net.GamePacketGenerator

public class GamePacketGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

Generates packets that correspond to the Subspace / Continuum protocol, and requests to encrypt and send them out to the SS server.

Constructor Summary
GamePacketGenerator(Sender outboundQueue, SSEncryption ssEncryption, java.util.Timer timer)
          Creates a new instance of GamePacketGenerator.

composeImmediatePacket

public void composeImmediatePacket(int[] array,
                                   int size)
Adds a packet to the immediate outgoing queue, ignoring any other packets in the standard queue it could be clustered with. Fast but not as efficient.

Parameters:
array - Packet to add

sendReliableMessage

public void sendReliableMessage(ByteArray message)
Sends a reliable message that must receive an ACKnowledged packet in response. The ReliablePacketHandler will continue to resend the packet until the ACK message is received.

Parameters:
message -

sendClientKey

public void sendClientKey(int clientKey)
Sends the client key / encryption request packet (bi-directional packet 0x01) using the provided key.

Parameters:
clientKey - Key to send

sendSyncPacket

public void sendSyncPacket(int numPacketsSent,
                           int numPacketsReceived)
Sends a synchronization request packet (bi-directional packet 0x05) to the server to verify they aren't working on different time.

Parameters:
numPacketsSent - Number of packets that have been sent so far
numPacketsReceived - Number of packets that have been received so far

sendSyncResponse

public void sendSyncResponse(int syncTime)
Sends a synchrozination response packet (bi-directional packet 0x06) after receiving a sync request packet.

Parameters:
syncTime - Timestamp found in the sync request packet this packet is responding to

sendPasswordPacket

public void sendPasswordPacket(java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String password)
Sends a password packet (C2S 0x09), including all necessary login data, after receiving the server encryption key for this session. NOTE: User MUST exist before attempting to log in. Core does not create user accounts.

Parameters:
name - Bot's pre-existing login name
password - Bot's account password

sendAck

public void sendAck(int ackID)
Sends an acknolwedgement packet in response to a reliable packet sent by the server.

Parameters:
ackID - ACK ID of the reliable packet sent that must be returned

sendArenaLoginPacket

public void sendArenaLoginPacket(byte shipType,
                                 short xResolution,
                                 short yResolution,
                                 short arenaType,
                                 java.lang.String arenaName)
Sends the arena login packet, changing the bot to the specified arena.

Parameters:
shipType - 0-7 in-game ships, 8 spectator
xResolution - X resolution to enter with
yResolution - Y resolution to enter with
arenaType - Pub # for specific pub; 0xFFFF random pub; 0xFFFD for priv arena
arenaName - Arena name if arena type is 0xFFFD

sendPositionPacket

public void sendPositionPacket(byte direction,
                               short xVelocity,
                               short yPosition,
                               byte toggle,
                               short xPosition,
                               short yVelocity,
                               short bounty,
                               short energy,
                               short weapon)
Sends a position packet based on position information provided.

Parameters:
direction - Value from 0 to 39 representing direciton ship is facing in SS degrees
xVelocity - Velocity ship on the x axis
yPosition - Current y position on the map (0-16384)
toggle - Bitvector for cloak, stealth, UFO status
xPosition - Current x position on the map (0-16384)
yVelocity - Velocity of ship on the y axis
bounty - Current bounty
energy - Current ship energy
weapon - Weapon number if firing a weapon at this position; 0 if none

sendChatPacket

public void sendChatPacket(byte messageType,
                           byte soundCode,
                           short userID,
                           java.lang.String message)
Sends a chat message.

Parameters:
messageType - Type of message being sent -- public, error, etc. (0x00 to 0x09)
soundCode - Number of the sound attached to this message, if any
userID - For message types 0x04 and 0x05, player ID of target
message - Text to send

sendClusteredPacket

public void sendClusteredPacket()
Sends numerous packets in one cluster (all packets queued by composePacket methods).

sendArenaLeft

public void sendArenaLeft()
Sends an Arena Left packet, notifying all that the bot has left the arena.

sendDisconnect

public void sendDisconnect()
Sends disconnect packet, informing the server that the client has disconnected.

sendSpectatePacket

public void sendSpectatePacket(short playerID)
Sends a request to spectate on a given player ID.

Parameters:
playerID - ID of player to spectate

sendFlagRequestPacket

public void sendFlagRequestPacket(short flagID)
Sends a request to pick up the flag of the specified ID.

Parameters:
flagID - ID of flag to pick up

sendFlagDropPacket

public void sendFlagDropPacket()
Sends the signal to drop all flags carried.

sendBannerPacket

public void sendBannerPacket(byte[] banner)
Sets a personal banner for the bot. The banner is in BMP format without any palette information, size 12x8, for a total of 96 bytes.

Parameters:
banner - Banner data to set as bot's banner (96 bytes, 12x8 BMP, no palette)

sendShipChangePacket

public void sendShipChangePacket(short ship)
Sets the bot as a given ship number. Unlike TWCore ship numbering standards, the SS protocol uses ship 0 as warbird and 8 as spectator.

Parameters:
ship - Number of ship to change to; 0 is WB, 8 is spec

sendFreqChangePacket

public void sendFreqChangePacket(short freq)
Sets the bot to a given frequency.

Parameters:
freq - Frequency to set to

sendAttachRequestPacket

public void sendAttachRequestPacket(short playerId)
Requests an attachment to a specific player ID, or a detachment. If ID is -1, the operation is a detach.

Parameters:
playerId - PlayerID to attach to

sendMassiveChunkPacket

public void sendMassiveChunkPacket(ByteArray data)
Sends a massive chunk packet to the server. Used for file transfers, mostly only in the case of when the bot executes a *putfile. (Else the server will probably reject it.)

Parameters:
data - Data to send

sendFile

public void sendFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                     ByteArray fileData)
Sends a file to the server. Normally only used in conjunction with the *putfile command and the 0x19 S2C packet (see GamePacketInterpreter).

Parameters:
fileName - Name to associate with the file
fileData - File data, compressed using ZLib compression

sendPlayerDeath

public void sendPlayerDeath(int playerID,
                            int bounty)
Send a death packet for the bot. This is not done automatically after receiving terminal damage, but is instead the option of the bot controller.

Parameters:
playerID - ID of the player who killed the bot
bounty - Bot's bounty at the time of death
